intro: Seseli purpurascens, commonly known as purple flax or purple seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, purple to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of the carrot family. Seseli purpurascens is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, dry climates.
